name: easy drape bandana
notes:
looking for your next *quick, wearable* crochet project? **say hello to the easy drape bandana**—a beginner-friendly kerchief that’s soft, stylish, and full of handmade charm. worked entirely in double crochet from the bottom up, this breezy triangle drapes effortlessly, while optional beaded ties add playful swing to every outfit. 

made with silky-smooth **[furls wander][1]** yarn, each stitch glides from your hook and settles into a fabric with luxurious sheen and bounce—perfect for hair accessories that need comfort without sacrificing structure. 

---

## yarn & notions

* **yarn (#4 worsted):** [furls wander – 100 % premium acrylic][2]

  * yardage: **s** 45 yd / 41 m • **m** 65 yd / 59 m • **l** 85 yd / 77 m 
* **hook:** 4 . 5 mm (us 7) or size to obtain gauge
* **optional:** 1 mm hook for adding beads, 2 × 15 mm wooden beads, tapestry needle, scissors

---

## gauge

18 sts × 7 rows in double crochet, blocked (gauge is flexible for this project). 

---

## finished measurements

| size   | top edge      | depth         | 
| ------ | ------------- | ------------- | 
| small  | 14 in / 35 cm | 7 in / 18 cm  | 
| medium | 17 in / 43 cm | 9 in / 23 cm  |
| large  | 20 in / 50 cm | 11 in / 27 cm | 

---

## difficulty

**easy / beginner (cyc)** 

---

## construction & features

bottom-up triangle worked flat with simple edge increases. optional beaded ties are added seamlessly in the final row—no seaming required. designed to showcase the drape and sheen of furls wander. 
---

## skills needed

* double crochet (us terms)
* increasing at row edges
* optional bead application
